ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotypes (intellectual disability and hypertonia) were diagnosed with this condition. The patient shares these core features, making this the most likely diagnosis.

Hypertonia and intellectual disability are common features in spastic cerebral palsy. The absence of reported motor impairments doesn't exclude this diagnosis as the patient may have milder involvement.
Presents with intellectual disability and can have associated neurological features including hypertonia, though less commonly than in recessive forms.
Features intellectual disability and can present with increased muscle tone (hypertonia), though more commonly presents with ataxia and happy demeanor.
Can present with intellectual disability and hypertonia, though typically occurs in females and has additional features like hand stereotypies and regression.
X-linked intellectual disability that can present with hypertonia, though less specific match than the autosomal recessive forms seen in reference cases.
